website_summaries.verdict: A classic design that gives off a timeless appeal, this new addition to the Puma Roma collection stays true to its roots and delivers great quality, comfort, and style. The low-top Puma Roma Classic VTG sneaker has captured the favor of longtime Puma Roma fans and has gained new ones.
pros: The majority of the consumers agree that the Puma Roma Classic VTG provides excellent comfort for the foot
Multiple buyers reported that this low-top sneaker from Puma has a great quality
Many commenters mention how they love and enjoy wearing the sneaker
Like most low-top Puma shoes, this Roma Classic VTG sneaker delivers a nice style that a couple of purchasers appreciate
A fair amount of critics say that this pair of sneakers is a great buy and they will recommend it to friends
cons: This version of the Puma Roma may fit a little narrow on feet as what a couple of wearers has described
A few users note in their reviews that the shoe may not have good arch support

customer_reviews.title: tight, but right
customer_reviews.text: Reviews saying these run a bit small are true, so if other shoes normally are snug, move up a 1/2 size. I like a snug fit and have old wooden "shoe stretchers" so I'm fine. Was pleasantly surprised by how lightweight these are. They're definitely a "fashion shoe" these days but are much, much better than a typical Puma shoe was in the 1970s, including the Roma. Suede & heavy rubber were the brand's norm. You could do short runs in these, and I plan to (just for fun) with my local running group. The colors were slightly darker than I expected but it could be my screen/settings. Still fun & vibrant! Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scott T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Wish these were more durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Puma Romas. I love the look and fit of these shoes. Always have. And my last two pairs lasted years. Unfortunately, this pair started falling apart within 6-8 weeks of purchase. The toe cap is separating from both shoes, and I doubt they'll last the summer. I'm really disappointed. After contacting Puma, they don't seem interested in standing behind their product. Won't be buying Romas again.
